other_tests.findings: Multifocal papillary thyroid cancer with characteristic papillary configuration, follicular cells with clear nuclei, nuclear grooves, and intranuclear inclusions.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initially scheduled craniofacial surgery was delayed, and the remaining thyroid lobe was excised during a second neck operation 2.5 months later. There was no evidence of carcinoma in the specimen from the completion thyroidectomy.

other_tests.findings: Uptake in the thyroid bed only; serum thyroglobulin (Tg) at that time was 3.7 ng/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A posttherapy WBS showed the same focus of uptake noted in the diagnostic WBS.

other_tests.findings: Findings suspicious for a carcinoma with clear cell features.
Negative for evidence of cancer but showed evidence of lymphocytic thyroiditis.
Only 131I uptake was in the thyroid bed; serum Tg at that time was 6.8 ng/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A post-therapy WBS again revealed uptake in the thyroid bed area only.
